data.title: Rab Butler
data.text:
AKA Richard Austen Butler

Born: 9-Dec-1902

Birthplace: Attock Serai, India

Died: 8-Mar-1982

Location of death: Great Yeldham, Essex, England

Cause of death: unspecified

Gender: Male

Race or Ethnicity: White

Sexual orientation: Straight

Occupation: Politician

Nationality: England

Executive summary: UK Foreign Secretary, 1963-64

Father: Montagu Sherard Dawes Butler

Mother: Anne Gertrude Smith

Wife: Sydney Elizabeth Courtauld (m. 1926, one son, two daughters)

Son: Adam Courtauld Butler (former MP, b. 11-Oct-1931)

Son: Samuel James Butler

High School: Marlborough College

University: Pembroke College, Cambridge University

Administrator: Rector, University of Glasgow (1956-59)

Administrator: Master, Trinity College, Cambridge University (1965-78)

Administrator: Chancellor, University of Essex (1966-82)

UK Foreign Secretary (1963-64)

UK Minister Deputy Prime Minister, First Secretary of State (1962-64)

UK Home Secretary (1957-62)

UK Leader of the House of Commons (1955-61)

Lord Privy Seal (1955-59)

Chancellor of the Exchequer (1951-55)

UK Minister of Labour (1945)

UK Official President, Board of Education (1941-45)

UK Minister Under-Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs (1938-41)

UK Minister Under-Secretary of State for India (1932-37)

UK Member of Parliament for Saffron Walden (1929-65)

Carlton Club

Conservative Party (UK) Chairman (1959-61)

Life Peerage 19-Feb-1965 as Baron Butler of Saffron Walden

Knighthood Kt., Order of the Garter (1971)
